trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.MenuItemClick"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.MenuItemDataBound"></xref> events of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu"></xref> control.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs> class is used to store the event data passed to an event handler for the events in the following table.
Event
Description
Occurs when a menu item is clicked.
This event is commonly used to synchronize a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control with another control on the page.
Occurs when a menu item is bound to data.
This event is commonly used to modify a menu item before it is rendered in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control.
Depending on the event raised, you can access the menu item clicked by the user or the menu item being bound to data by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs.Item%2A> property.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs> class, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs"></xref> class using the specified menu item.
Use this constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs> class from the specified menu item.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs> class.
Property
Initial value
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItem> object specified by the `item` parameter.
For the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.MenuItemClick"></xref> event, this parameter represents the menu item clicked by the user.
For the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.MenuItemDataBound"></xref> event, this parameter represents the menu item being bound to data.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs"></xref> class using the specified menu item, command source, and event arguments.
Use this constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs> class from the specified menu item, command source, and event arguments.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs> class.
Property
Initial value
The value of the `originalArgs.CommandArgument` parameter.
The value of the `originalArgs.CommandName` parameter.
The <xref:System.Object> specified by the `commandSource` parameter.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItem> object specified by the `item` parameter.
For the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.MenuItemClick"></xref> event, this parameter represents the menu item clicked by the user.
For the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.MenuItemDataBound"></xref> event, this parameter represents the menu item being bound to data.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that raised the event.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs"></xref> that contains the command name and command argument values for the menu item.
Gets the <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that raised the event.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs.CommandSource%2A> property to access the <xref:System.Object> that raised the event.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that raised the event.
Gets the menu item associated with the event raised.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuEventArgs.Item%2A> property to access or modify the properties of the menu item associated with the event raised.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.MenuItemClick> event, this item represents the menu item clicked by the user.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.MenuItemDataBound> event, this item represents the menu item being bound to data.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItem"></xref> that represents the menu item associated with the event raised.
